definition: to admit an error/to acknowledge one's mistake
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver

sentences.english: We cannot rule out the possibility of mistaken identity.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能排除有认错人的可能。

sentences.english: It rankles me that Scott never apologizes when he does something wrong.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特做错事时从不认错道歉，真是令我心痛。

sentences.english: Paul said to admit, zhaotian removed his purchasing position.
sentences.chinese: 保言认错，兆天撤去他的采购职务。

sentences.english: The man, who can express his apology as soon as he knows what he did just now is wrong, is a real wise.
sentences.chinese: 立即表达心中的想法，勇于认错才是真正的勇者。

sentences.english: They mistake their man if they think they can frighten him.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们认为可以把他吓倒，那是认错人了。

sentences.english: Jianye is not able to locate her, and is unaware that Qiuhua has gone home to confess.
sentences.chinese: 建业到处找不到秋桦，却不知秋桦已自己回家认错。

sentences.english: A fault confessed is half redressed.
sentences.chinese: 承认错误，等于改正一半。

sentences.english: Gunther: Sorry. She thought you were somebody else.
He is often caught not recognizing players, especially when smaller countries play.
sentences.chinese: 他常常会认错球员，尤其在小国间的比赛中。

sentences.english: Confession of a fault make half amend.
They are the first to admit when they’ve made a mistake.
sentences.chinese: 犯错时，他们总是第一个承认错误的。

sentences.english: Lifton also says that confessions of wrong doing are an important part of the demand for purity.
sentences.chinese: Lifton还说承认错误是追求纯净的重要部分。

sentences.english: They boasted that they could beat that new team, but they lost and had to eat crow.
sentences.chinese: 他们自夸能击败那支新队，但是他们输了，只好认错。

sentences.english: Dried tangerine or orange peel hypocrisy mistake, diddle red trust in February.
sentences.chinese: 陈皮假意认错，骗取二月红信任。

sentences.english: But the reality is, a woman loves a man more when he will admit mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 而事实上，女人更爱一个会承认错误的人。

definition: to admit defeat/to give in/to acknowledge a mistake/to apologize/to be amenable to persuasion
to recognize one's mistakes and be able to reform oneself (idiom)
to kneel/to go down on one's knees
to plea for leniency/to ask for a favor
to err/to make a mistake/to do the wrong thing
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
